page.title: 09ST.ANDREW'S CHURCH KEMBERTON
page.content: They were the work of Joseph Farmer who also designed the church tower. The east window which was installed in 1920 and shows Jesus on the cross is dedicated to the youngest son of the Rev. W. Blaby who was killed in the First World War. There is an old rectory next to the church but since 1980 the rectory has been a modern house across the road. There is 1 service each Sunday and the congregation is usually small. There is also a Sunday school with about 10 children. One of the older residents recalls the days earlier this century when most villagers and people from the surrounding hamlets attended the church. Each year a Sunday school fete was held in a farmer's field. Children were also taken on horse charabanc trips to the Wrekin.
